name: Mahamrityunjay Mantra
title: The Great Death-Conquering Mantra
description: The Mahamrityunjay Mantra is one of the most powerful mantras dedicated to Lord Shiva, believed to conquer death and provide immortality. It is mentioned in the Rig Veda and is considered a life-saving mantra.
significance: Provides protection from death, removes fear of death, brings longevity, and provides spiritual liberation.

seo.description: Complete Mahamrityunjay Mantra with lyrics, meaning, and benefits. Learn the proper way to chant this powerful Shiva mantra.

sections.title: Mahamrityunjay Mantra
sections.content: The Mahamrityunjay Mantra is the most powerful mantra dedicated to Lord Shiva, known as the death-conquering mantra. It is believed to provide protection from untimely death and grant longevity.

sections.title: Historical Significance
sections.content: This mantra appears in the Rig Veda (7.59.12) and is also found in the Yajur Veda. It was revealed to the sage Shukracharya and has been used for healing and protection for thousands of years.

sections.title: Complete Mantra with Meaning
sections.content: The complete Mahamrityunjay Mantra with detailed explanation.

subsections.title: Mantra Lyrics
subsections.english:
Om Tryambakam Yajamahe Sugandhim Pushtivardhanam
Urvarukamiva Bandhanan Mrityor Mukshiya Maamritat‡••
subsections.meaning: We worship the three-eyed Lord Shiva, who is fragrant and nourishes all beings. May He free us from death, for the sake of immortality, just as the cucumber is freed from its vine.

subsections.title: Word by Word Meaning
subsections.english:
Om - Pranava (God)
Tryambakam - Three-eyed (Shiva)
Yajamahe - We worship
Sugandhim - Fragrant
Pushtivardhanam - Nourishing and strengthening
Urvarukam - Cucumber (easily detached)
Iva - Like
Bandhanat - From bondage
Mrityoh - From death
Mukshiya - Be freed
Ma - Not
Amritat - From immortality
subsections.meaning: The mantra uses the metaphor of a cucumber easily detaching from its vine to pray for liberation from the cycle of death and rebirth.

sections.title: Benefits of Chanting Mahamrityunjay Mantra
sections.content: The spiritual and practical benefits of regular chanting.

subsections.title: Spiritual Benefits
subsections.content: Provides protection from untimely death, removes fear of death, brings spiritual liberation, and connects with Shiva consciousness.

subsections.title: Material Benefits
subsections.content: Improves health, provides healing from diseases, brings longevity, removes obstacles, and provides mental peace.

sections.title: How to Chant
sections.content: Proper method and guidelines for chanting Mahamrityunjay Mantra.

subsections.title: Best Time
subsections.content: Early morning after bath, especially on Mondays and during Mahashivratri. Also effective during eclipses and difficult times.

subsections.title: Procedure
subsections.content: Sit facing north, light a diya, offer water and bilva leaves, then chant 108 times with devotion and concentration.
